Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is partially black in section, interior covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, exterior is slightly ribbed and covered with a red-brown slip, with two lines of cord-marked decoration and remains of three lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.176)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36403) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36403)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 260 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
